intro: Ischaemum elimalayanum, commonly known as the Himalayan false brome, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, leafy stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Ischaemum elimalayanum is adapted to cold climates and is relatively drought-tolerant.
